content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the graph of the line given by the parametric function <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses equals open parentheses negative 1 plus 3 t comma 2 minus t close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> may also be given by which of the following?

choices.label: The parametric function defined by <math alttext="open parentheses 3 t comma negative t close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

The parametric function defined by <math alttext="open parentheses negative 1 plus 3 t comma 2 plus t close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

The parametric function defined by <math alttext="open parentheses 5 plus 3 t comma negative t close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

The parametric function defined by <math alttext="open parentheses 1 minus 3 t comma negative 2 plus t close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

content.answer: The parametric function defined by <math alttext="open parentheses 5 plus 3 t comma negative t close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
